reasoning: CTEPH is a rare form of pulmonary hypertension developing after acute pulmonary embolism. Estimated incidence 0.5-1.0 per 100k; develops in ~2-4% of PE survivors. Prevalence estimated 5-10 per 100k in developed countries. Reports both incidence (new cases) and prevalence (existing burden).
source: Pepke-Zaba J et al. (2011). Chronic thromboembolic pulmonary hypertension: Results from an international prospective registry. Circulation. 124(18):1973-1981
